text: Oh everyone I am Niharika and welcome to

first phrase that we have for you is to
get off your high horse now at times
when you meet people there are people
who are extremely arrogant and think
they're far more superior than the
others so for such people you can use
this phrase for example you can say you
need to get off your high horse you are
not as smart as you think you are so
which means this person thinks that he's
way to better than the others
so he needs to get off his high horse
[Music]
second one that we have for you is to
feed like a horse of course horse is
quite a big animal and he definitely

a day
Plus oats and fruits so it's a lot of

now when British English people use to
flog a dead horse whereas in American
English people use to beat a dead horse
and what it means well it means that
when you are trying to put a lot of

to do something and that is not going to
succeed it's basically a fruitless
effort this means that you are flogging

so he's beating a flogging a dead horse

the fourth phrase that we have for you
is hold your horses now when someone
uses this phrase for you they mean that
you need to slow down you need to put a
break because maybe you're going way too
fast for example if you have to use this
phrase in your daily conversation you
can say well she has invested a lot of
money and she needs to hold her horses
this means she needs to go slow put a
brake on her investment if this is what
this phrase mean the phrase that we have
for you is straight from the horse's

you hear some kind of news are some

news
